pr_title: Refactor/rename metrics related classes for NaN support

timeline.bodyText: The reason for changing this class is discussed in this thread
timeline.author: yyanyy

timeline.bodyText: inputschema can be null at this point.
timeline.author: giovannifumarola

replies.bodyText: I'll add a validation check to ensure they are not null
replies.author: yyanyy

replies.bodyText: I agree. Let's add checks to fail when metricsConfig or inputSchema is null. This is a useful method so I think it is worth keeping it public, but we would ideally not fail with a NullPointerException. This is not called in a tight loop, so it should be fine to add the checks on each call.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Yes, sorry I overwrote my own earlier change that addressed this when I renamed this file...
replies.author: yyanyy

timeline.author: giovannifumarola
giovannifumarola

+  public static Map<Integer, Long> getNanValueCounts(

timeline.bodyText: Since we expect to add lower and upper bounds to this class (since Parquet and ORC do not ignore NaN values), I think this should probably be called FloatFieldMetrics. That way we don't need to rename when this adds support for lower and upper.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Sounds good; I'll keep the javadoc as is since they currently reflect reality, and will update comments to mention tracking float fields when the class starts to track upper/lower bound
replies.author: yyanyy

timeline.bodyText: This demonstrates the drawback to adding too much context to an exception message. The method and class should be in the stack trace and renames require updating this message. Let's keep the good error message, but remove the class and method names.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.message: Refactor/rename metrics related classes for NaN support
move generic testing outside of parquet folder
fix timestamp type to use microseconds instead
fix timestamp type to use microseconds instead
